reference.title: lcTime
reference.shortdesc: The <lcTime> specifies the time expected to complete an activity. You can specify the time both as text to display to the user and as an attribute value that follows a specific time format.

section.title: Contains
section.p: The content model of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

section.title: Contained By
section.p: The parents of this element may differ based on where it is used. Content model information is located here:

example.title: Example
example.codeblock: <learningOverview id="overview"> <title>Learning Overview topic</title> <learningOverviewbody> <lcDuration><title>Duration</title> <lcTime name="lcTime" value="00:15">15 minutes</> </lcDuration> </learningOverviewbody> </learningOverview>

strow.stentry: The name used to indicate this data.
There is no assumed time-specific data format or type. If you use a specific datatype for the time value, specify it here.
There is no assumed time-specific data format or type for the time value.
